== Problem ==
----
Use the basic HTML markup : bold, italic, headers...


== Solution ==
--------------
{{{
<html>
<head>
<script src="brython.js"></script>
</head>
<body>
<script type="text/python">
doc <= B("Hello world !")
</script>
</body>
</html>
}}}

*B* is a built-in name matching the HTML tag `<B>` (bold)

`B("text")` returns an object matching the HTML `<b>text</b>`

The other HTML tags for text markup each have a built-in name in Brython :
*I, H1, H2,...*
